definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Rom. 2:23 You who boast in the law, do you by transgression of the law dishonor God?
sentences.chinese: 羅二23你指著律法誇口，自己卻犯律法玷辱神麼？

sentences.english: I have therefore glory in Christ Jesus towards God.
sentences.chinese: 所以對於事奉天主的事，我可以在耶穌基督內誇口。

sentences.english: She is hasl dressed up nowhere to go.
sentences.chinese: 她服裝得整一律卻無處誇口。

sentences.english: His boastful throat soon grew hoarse with thirst, and he betook himself to prayer.
sentences.chinese: 不久，那誇口的喉嚨因乾渴而沙啞，他開始祈求。

sentences.english: The lotus offers its beauty to the heaven, the grass its service to the earth.
sentences.chinese: 菡萏向長天誇口它的嬌美，小草則緘默地侍奉土地。

sentences.english: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;
sentences.chinese: 所以無論誰，都不可拿人誇口，因爲萬有全是你們的。

sentences.english: Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God
sentences.chinese: 你稱爲猶太人，又倚靠律法，且指着神誇口。

sentences.english: Smoke boasts to the sky, and Ashes to the earth, that they are brothers to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 煙霧向天空，灰燼向大地誇口，都說它們是火的兄弟。

sentences.english: No one likes him because he brags about how rich his family is.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人喜歡他，因爲他老是誇口他家多有錢。

sentences.english: John could horse-back ride with the best of them, but he never boasted about it.
sentences.chinese: 約翰的馬術不下於任何人，但他從不誇口。

sentences.english: Ross went on, somewhat boastfully , to explain just how real estate profits were made.
sentences.chinese: 洛斯於是略帶誇口的語氣說明地產的生意應該怎麼做。

definition: to counter every move/to be full of tricks
to force someone to do something
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
